'''Orbis Technologies, Inc.''' is a medium sized American technology firm that provides advanced [[Text mining|semantic text analytics]].
==History== The company was incorporated in 2005 by [[Brian Ippolito]].
==Products and services== The firm provides a semantic infrastructure that integrates multiple existing [[open source]], [[commercial off-the-shelf]], and [[government off-the-shelf]] entity extractors to produce an [[entity extraction]] result in standard industry data formats,<ref>http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-rdfarch.html</ref> which include [[XML|eXtensible Markup Language (XML)]] and [[RDF|Resource Description Framework (RDF)]]. Orbis is one of the first technology companies to apply [[semantic technology]] and [[cloud computing]] beyond the tactical intelligence domain<ref>http://csel.eng.ohio-state.edu/productions/intelligence/1_Patterns/Broadening_Checks/Grossman2007_SupportingTheCognitiveWorkOfIAS-Thesis.pdf</ref> to commercial sectors,<ref name="Hamby">[http://afei.org/events/1A03/Documents/2Steve%20Hamby.pdf]</ref> and [[museum informatics]].<ref>http://www.orbistechnologies.com/orbis-technologies-inc-collaborates-with-the-historic-annapolis-foundation-on-exhibit-of-the-citys-18th-century-craftsmen/</ref>
The company develops custom-built cloud-based analytics, using [[MapReduce]], to support [[entity extraction]], [[Named-entity recognition|relationship identification]], and semantic search in a Hadoop cloud-processing environment,<ref>http://www-304.ibm.com/easyaccess/fileserve?contentid=217007</ref> for a variety of purposes ranging from biomedical informatics<ref>http://www.cercs.gatech.edu/iucrc10/material/widener.pdf</ref> to military DCGS programs.<ref> http://dcgsa.apg.army.mil/ </ref> The cloud-based services involve transforming data to a format that can be processed by entity extractors, generate artifact metadata, and parse structured data elements; entity enhancement<ref>http://openjpa.apache.org/entity-enhancement.html</ref> and disambiguation solutions<ref>http://openjpa.apache.org/entity-enhancement.html</ref> resolve entity conflicts<ref>http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/summary?doi=10.1.1.66.7045</ref> and enable accurate cross-document correlation.<ref>http://clair.si.umich.edu/~radev/papers/progress/p1.pdf </ref>
==Locations== The company holds its corporate office in [[Annapolis, Maryland]], and additional offices in [[Jacksonville, Florida|Jacksonville]] and [[Orlando, Florida]], and [[Warner Robins, Georgia]].
